textBeforeTable: Loot can be found EVERYWHERE on Pandora. It falls from defeated enemies, is hidden in boxes, chests, lockers, safes and even toilets, can be bought from vending machines, and is given you you for completing quests. You can only carry so much loot in your backpack at one time, so always be mindful of how much space you have and what you need, then grab the best loot to sell for extra income. I recommend spending some Eridium to upgrade both your Backpack and your Bank Safe capacities at the Black Market Dealer to maximize the amount of loot you can carry and hold. The most difficult enemies will yield you the best equipment, also the more players that you are playing with will increase the chance at better loot items. textAfterTable: Orange Legendary Currently this is the top of the pyramid in terms of weaponry. These will always have increased perks you can't find in other weapons as well as fantastic bonuses. Pink Seraph Crystal After you complete the game you will gain access to Hyperius the Invincible. When you defeat him, he will drop a random number of Pink Seraph Crystals. These Crystals can be traded in at the Crystal Dealer in Oasis for weapons that are more rare than the Orange Legendary Weapons. That being said, you can only fight them once a day, unless you keep changing the clock, and the weapons don't look any more impressive than what you probably already have for Legendary Weapons. [hide][top]Elemental Weapons Elemental Weapons can be found on all weapons that you find with the exception of the White weapons. Having a good mix of elemental weapons can mean the difference between a grueling difficult battle and a nice easy battle. The key to elemental weaponry is to know what elements work best against what enemies and their enhancements. Below is a breakdown of the weapons and their specialties.
